posts.title: Room 213
posts.excerpt: The story follows the endangered relationship of an architect and his wife, a photographer. After being married for 10 years, they have lost all emotional connections with each other. However,they both still want to save their marriage so they resort to extreme measures to revive their attraction for one another and rekindle their dying passions. …

posts.title: Submarino
posts.excerpt: synopsis Two siblings who grew up in a dysfunctional household pass their damage along to those around them in this drama from Danish filmmaker Thomas Vinterberg. Nick (Jacob Cedergren) was raised by a mother with serious drinking problems who inflicted physical and emotional cruelty on her children. Now in his early thirties, Nick is an …

posts._title: Mark Goodall – Sweet & Savage: The World Through The Shockumentary Film Lens (2006)
posts.title: Sweet & Savage: The World Through The Shockumentary Film Lens
posts.excerpt: The Back Cover wrote: Mondo Cane in 1962 was the blueprint for a shocking, controversial and influential documentary film cycle. Known collectively as “mondo films” or “shockumentaries,” this enduring series of films is a precursor of the reality TV show. A box-office draw for three decades and now a staple of the video rental market, …

posts._title: Wolfgang Staudte – Schicksal aus zweiter Hand (1949)
posts.title: Schicksal aus zweiter Hand
posts.excerpt: Ein Versicherungsangestellter heiratet eine Frau aus reichen Haus, ohne Einverständnis ihrer Eltern. Eines Tages geht er zu einem Wahrsager, der seiner Frau ein jähes Ende prophezeit.

posts._title: Andrew Robinson – Satyajit Ray The Inner Eye: The Biography of a Master Filmmaker (1989)
posts.title: Satyajit Ray The Inner Eye: The Biography of a Master Filmmaker
posts.excerpt: Book Description This is the best-known biography of the film giant, based on extensive interviews with Ray himself, his actors, collaborators, and a deep knowledge of Bengali culture. This second edition contains extensive new material covering Ray’s final three films made in 1989-1991, a discussion of his artistic legacy, and the most comprehensive bibliography of …

posts._title: Nils Malmros – Kammesjukjul AKA Pal Christmas (1978)
posts.title: Kammesjukjul
posts.excerpt: ‘Kammesjukjul’ is a children’s Christmas movie made for television. It is basically a portrayal of the odd (in retrospect) childhood experiences which, at the time they occur, hold some mysterious significance. The movie is set at Christmas time, but the Christmas setting is not really important for the appreciation of the movie. The plot: Mads …

posts._title: Chris Marker & Pierre Lhomme – Le Joli mai (1963)
posts.title: Le Joli mai
posts.excerpt: Some info: Setting out to create an evocative portrait of his beloved hometown of Paris and to “track it like a detective with a telescope and a microphone,” Chris Marker’s astounding and astute film LE JOLI MAI emerges as an early example of Marker’s unique cinema of poetic cultural anthropology.
